page.title: 09FUNTINGTON C.P.SCHOOL
page.content: The original school was constructed in{1874}as a Board School, serving mainly the children of{'land}workers'. Many children walked several miles to attend school. During the{second world war}evacuees from{LONDON}and{PORTSMOUTH}attended the school raising the school roll to over two hundred. The building of a new housing estate at West Ashling increased dramatically the school roll and in {1970 a new {school}was constructed. The Old School continued to house the infants and not until{1984}was the new school {extended}and all pupils were taught together. The{present Funtington School}has 70 pupils on roll. The{old school}sadly, has been sold and is to be transformed into 4 private dwellings.
